reviewText: This is a short documentary about three women that discuss the outdated legalisms of the  Pentecostal faith. The traditional way the women dressed in the 1940's and before has changed. Cutting their "crowning glory", (hair), wearing long dresses, always covering her arms, no jewelry, make-up, etc., are a few topics discussed. More importantly, the emotional turmoil of  making the decision to change and how it devastated the older and more traditional generation and church members.
